# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the solution using Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = String[]
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)  # add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example:
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer id dui eget arcu facilisis condimentum."
print(wrap_string(s))
```
This `wrap_string` function splits the input string into words and checks their combined length for each line. If it exceeds `text_width`, a new line is created, otherwise the current line continues. The lines are joined with newline character `"\n"`.
